4721        public int hash(final long[] data) {
4722            if (data == null) return 0;
4723            long seed = this.seed, a = this.seed + b4, b = this.seed + b3, c = this.seed + b2, d = this.seed + b1;
4724            final int len = data.length;
4725            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
4726                a ^= data[i-3] * b1; a = (a << 23 | a >>> 41) * b3;
4727                b ^= data[i-2] * b2; b = (b << 25 | b >>> 39) * b4;
4728                c ^= data[i-1] * b3; c = (c << 29 | c >>> 35) * b5;
4729                d ^= data[i  ] * b4; d = (d << 31 | d >>> 33) * b1;
4730                seed += a + b + c + d;
4731            }
4732            seed += b5;
4733            switch (len & 3) {
4734                case 1: seed = wow(seed, b1 ^ data[len-1]); break;
4735                case 2: seed = wow(seed + data[len-2], b2 + data[len-1]); break;
4736                case 3: seed = wow(seed + data[len-3], b2 + data[len-2]) ^ wow(seed + data[len-1], seed ^ b3); break;
4737            }
4738            seed = (seed ^ seed << 16) * (len ^ b0 ^ seed >>> 32);
4739            return (int)(seed - (seed >>> 32));
4740        }

4777        /**
4778         * Hashes only a subsection of the given data, starting at start (inclusive) and ending before end (exclusive).

4780         * @param data  the char array to hash
4781         * @param start the start of the section to hash (inclusive)
4782         * @param end   the end of the section to hash (exclusive)
4783         * @return a 32-bit hash code for the requested section of data
4784         */
4785        public int hash(final char[] data, final int start, final int end) {
4786            if (data == null || start >= end)
4787                return 0;
4788            long seed = this.seed;//b1 ^ b1 >>> 41 ^ b1 << 53;
4789            final int len = Math.min(end, data.length);
4790            for (int i = start + 3; i < len; i+=4) {
4791                seed = mum(
4792                        mum(data[i-3] ^ b1, data[i-2] ^ b2) + seed,
4793                        mum(data[i-1] ^ b3, data[i] ^ b4));
4794            }
4795            switch (len - start & 3) {
4796                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
4797                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^ b3, b4 ^ data[len-1]); break;
4798                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ data[len-2], b3 ^ data[len-1]); break;
4799                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ data[len-3] ^ (long) data[len - 2] << 16, b1 ^ data[len-1]); break;
4800            }
4801            return (int) mum(seed ^ seed << 16, len - start ^ b0);
4802        }

4804        /**
4805         * Hashes only a subsection of the given data, starting at start (inclusive) and ending before end (exclusive).
4806         *
4807         * @param data  the String or other CharSequence to hash
4808         * @param start the start of the section to hash (inclusive)
4809         * @param end   the end of the section to hash (exclusive)
4810         * @return a 32-bit hash code for the requested section of data
4811         */
4812        public int hash(final CharSequence data, final int start, final int end) {
4813            if (data == null || start >= end)
4814                return 0;
4815            long seed = this.seed;//b1 ^ b1 >>> 41 ^ b1 << 53;
4816            final int len = Math.min(end, data.length());
4817            for (int i = start + 3; i < len; i+=4) {
4818                seed = mum(
4819                        mum(data.charAt(i-3) ^ b1, data.charAt(i-2) ^ b2) + seed,
4820                        mum(data.charAt(i-1) ^ b3, data.charAt(i) ^ b4));
4821            }
4822            switch (len - start & 3) {
4823                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
4824                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^ b3, b4 ^ data.charAt(len-1)); break;
4825                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ data.charAt(len-2), b3 ^ data.charAt(len-1)); break;
4826                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ data.charAt(len-3) ^ (long) data.charAt(len - 2) << 16, b1 ^ data.charAt(len-1)); break;
4827            }
4828            return (int) mum(seed ^ seed << 16, len - start ^ b0);
4829        }

4927        public int hash(final Iterable<? extends CharSequence> data) {
4928            if (data == null) return 0;
4929            long seed = this.seed;
4930            final Iterator<? extends CharSequence> it = data.iterator();
4931            int len = 0;
4932            while (it.hasNext())
4933            {
4934                ++len;
4935                seed = mum(
4936                        mum(hash(it.next()) ^ b1, (it.hasNext() ? hash(it.next()) ^ b2 ^ ++len : b2)) + seed,
4937                        mum((it.hasNext() ? hash(it.next()) ^ b3 ^ ++len : b3), (it.hasNext() ? hash(it.next()) ^ b4 ^ ++len : b4)));
4938            }
4939            return (int) mum(seed ^ seed << 16, len ^ b0);
4940        }

4987            if (data == null) return 0L;
4988            seed += b1; seed ^= seed >>> 23 ^ seed >>> 48 ^ seed << 7 ^ seed << 53;
4989            final int len = data.length;
4990            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
4991                seed = mum(
4992                        mum((data[i-3] ? 0x9E3779B9L : 0x7F4A7C15L) ^ b1, (data[i-2] ? 0x9E3779B9L : 0x7F4A7C15L) ^ b2) + seed,
4993                        mum((data[i-1] ? 0x9E3779B9L : 0x7F4A7C15L) ^ b3, (data[i] ? 0x9E3779B9L : 0x7F4A7C15L) ^ b4));
4994            }
4995            switch (len & 3) {
4996                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
4997                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^ (data[len-1] ? 0x9E37L : 0x7F4AL), b3 ^ (data[len-1]  ? 0x79B9L : 0x7C15L)); break;

5000            }
5001            seed = (seed ^ seed << 16) * (len ^ b0);
5002            return seed - (seed >>> 31) + (seed << 33);

5117        public static long hash64(long seed, final long[] data) {
5118            if (data == null) return 0L;
5119            seed += b1; seed ^= seed >>> 23 ^ seed >>> 48 ^ seed << 7 ^ seed << 53;
5120            long a = seed + b4, b = seed + b3, c = seed + b2, d = seed + b1;
5121            final int len = data.length;
5122            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
5123                a ^= data[i-3] * b1; a = (a << 23 | a >>> 41) * b3;
5124                b ^= data[i-2] * b2; b = (b << 25 | b >>> 39) * b4;
5125                c ^= data[i-1] * b3; c = (c << 29 | c >>> 35) * b5;
5126                d ^= data[i  ] * b4; d = (d << 31 | d >>> 33) * b1;
5127                seed += a + b + c + d;
5128            }
5129            seed += b5;
5130            switch (len & 3) {
5131                case 1: seed = wow(seed, b1 ^ data[len-1]); break;
5132                case 2: seed = wow(seed + data[len-2], b2 + data[len-1]); break;
5133                case 3: seed = wow(seed + data[len-3], b2 + data[len-2]) ^ wow(seed + data[len-1], seed ^ b3); break;
5134            }
5135            seed = (seed ^ seed << 16) * (len ^ b0 ^ seed >>> 32);
5136            return seed - (seed >>> 31) + (seed << 33);
5137        }

5175        /**
5176         * Hashes only a subsection of the given data, starting at start (inclusive) and ending before end (exclusive).
5177         *
5178         * @param data  the char array to hash
5179         * @param start the start of the section to hash (inclusive)
5180         * @param end   the end of the section to hash (exclusive)
5181         * @return a 32-bit hash code for the requested section of data
5182         */
5183        public static long hash64(long seed, final char[] data, final int start, final int end) {
5184            if (data == null || start >= end)
5185                return 0L;
5186            seed += b1; seed ^= seed >>> 23 ^ seed >>> 48 ^ seed << 7 ^ seed << 53;
5187            final int len = Math.min(end, data.length);
5188            for (int i = start + 3; i < len; i+=4) {
5189                seed = mum(
5190                        mum(data[i-3] ^ b1, data[i-2] ^ b2) + seed,
5191                        mum(data[i-1] ^ b3, data[i] ^ b4));
5192            }
5193            switch (len - start & 3) {
5194                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
5195                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^ b3, b4 ^ data[len-1]); break;
5196                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ data[len-2], b3 ^ data[len-1]); break;
5197                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ data[len-3] ^ (long) data[len - 2] << 16, b1 ^ data[len-1]); break;
5198            }
5199            return mum(seed ^ seed << 16, len - start ^ b0);
5200        }

5202        /**
5203         * Hashes only a subsection of the given data, starting at start (inclusive) and ending before end (exclusive).
5204         *
5205         * @param data  the String or other CharSequence to hash
5206         * @param start the start of the section to hash (inclusive)
5207         * @param end   the end of the section to hash (exclusive)
5208         * @return a 32-bit hash code for the requested section of data
5209         */
5210        public static long hash64(long seed, final CharSequence data, final int start, final int end) {
5211            if (data == null || start >= end)
5212                return 0L;
5213            seed += b1; seed ^= seed >>> 23 ^ seed >>> 48 ^ seed << 7 ^ seed << 53;
5214            final int len = Math.min(end, data.length());
5215            for (int i = start + 3; i < len; i+=4) {
5216                seed = mum(
5217                        mum(data.charAt(i-3) ^ b1, data.charAt(i-2) ^ b2) + seed,
5218                        mum(data.charAt(i-1) ^ b3, data.charAt(i) ^ b4));
5219            }
5220            switch (len - start & 3) {
5221                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
5222                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^ b3, b4 ^ data.charAt(len-1)); break;
5223                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ data.charAt(len-2), b3 ^ data.charAt(len-1)); break;
5224                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ data.charAt(len-3) ^ (long) data.charAt(len - 2) << 16, b1 ^ data.charAt(len-1)); break;
5225            }
5226            return mum(seed ^ seed << 16, len - start ^ b0);
5227        }

5524                a ^= data[i-3] * b1; a = (a << 23 | a >>> 41) * b3;

5578         * @param data  the char array to hash
5579         * @param start the start of the section to hash (inclusive)
5580         * @param end   the end of the section to hash (exclusive)
5581         * @return a 32-bit hash code for the requested section of data
5582         */
5583        public static int hash(long seed, final char[] data, final int start, final int end) {
5584            if (data == null || start >= end)
5585                return 0;
5586            seed += b1; seed ^= seed >>> 23 ^ seed >>> 48 ^ seed << 7 ^ seed << 53;
5587            final int len = Math.min(end, data.length);
5588            for (int i = start + 3; i < len; i+=4) {
5589                seed = mum(
5590                        mum(data[i-3] ^ b1, data[i-2] ^ b2) + seed,
5591                        mum(data[i-1] ^ b3, data[i] ^ b4));
5592            }
5593            switch (len - start & 3) {
5594                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
5595                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^ b3, b4 ^ data[len-1]); break;
5596                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ data[len-2], b3 ^ data[len-1]); break;
5597                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ data[len-3] ^ (long) data[len - 2] << 16, b1 ^ data[len-1]); break;
5598            }
5599            return (int) mum(seed ^ seed << 16, len - start ^ b0);
5600        }
5601
5602        /**
5603         * Hashes only a subsection of the given data, starting at start (inclusive) and ending before end (exclusive).
5604         *
5605         * @param data  the String or other CharSequence to hash
5606         * @param start the start of the section to hash (inclusive)
5607         * @param end   the end of the section to hash (exclusive)
5608         * @return a 32-bit hash code for the requested section of data
5609         */
5610        public static int hash(long seed, final CharSequence data, final int start, final int end) {
5611            if (data == null || start >= end)
5612                return 0;
5613            seed += b1; seed ^= seed >>> 23 ^ seed >>> 48 ^ seed << 7 ^ seed << 53;
5614            final int len = Math.min(end, data.length());
5615            for (int i = start + 3; i < len; i+=4) {
5616                seed = mum(
5617                        mum(data.charAt(i-3) ^ b1, data.charAt(i-2) ^ b2) + seed,
5618                        mum(data.charAt(i-1) ^ b3, data.charAt(i) ^ b4));
5619            }
5620            switch (len - start & 3) {
5621                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
5622                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^ b3, b4 ^ data.charAt(len-1)); break;
5623                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ data.charAt(len-2), b3 ^ data.charAt(len-1)); break;
5624                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ data.charAt(len-3) ^ (long) data.charAt(len - 2) << 16, b1 ^ data.charAt(len-1)); break;
5625            }
5626            return (int) mum(seed ^ seed << 16, len - start ^ b0);
5627        }
5628

5630        public static int hash(long seed, final char[][] data) {
5631            if (data == null) return 0;
5632            seed += b1; seed ^= seed >>> 23 ^ seed >>> 48 ^ seed << 7 ^ seed << 53;
5633            final int len = data.length;
5634            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
5635                seed = mum(
5636                        mum(hash(seed, data[i-3]) ^ b1, hash(seed, data[i-2]) ^ b2) + seed,
5637                        mum(hash(seed, data[i-1]) ^ b3, hash(seed, data[i  ]) ^ b4));
5638            }
5639            int t;
5640            switch (len & 3) {
5641                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
5642                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^((t = hash(seed, data[len-1])) >>> 16), b3 ^ (t & 0xFFFFL)); break;
5643                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ hash(seed, data[len-2]), b0 ^ hash(seed, data[len-1])); break;
5644                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ hash(seed, data[len-3]), b2 ^ hash(seed, data[len-2])) ^ mum(seed ^ hash(seed, data[len-1]), b4); break;
5645            }
5646            return (int) mum(seed ^ seed << 16, len ^ b0);
5647        }

5706        public static int hash(long seed, final CharSequence[]... data) {

5708            seed += b1; seed ^= seed >>> 23 ^ seed >>> 48 ^ seed << 7 ^ seed << 53;
5709            final int len = data.length;

5713                        mum(hash(seed, data[i-1]) ^ b3, hash(seed, data[i  ]) ^ b4));
5714            }
5715            int t;
5716            switch (len & 3) {
5717                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
5718                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^((t = hash(seed, data[len-1])) >>> 16), b3 ^ (t & 0xFFFFL)); break;
5719                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ hash(seed, data[len-2]), b0 ^ hash(seed, data[len-1])); break;

5724
5725        public static int hash(long seed, final Iterable<? extends CharSequence> data) {
5726            if (data == null) return 0;
5727            seed += b1; seed ^= seed >>> 23 ^ seed >>> 48 ^ seed << 7 ^ seed << 53;
5728            final Iterator<? extends CharSequence> it = data.iterator();
5729            int len = 0;
5730            while (it.hasNext())
5731            {
5732                ++len;
5733                seed = mum(
5734                        mum(hash(seed, it.next()) ^ b1, (it.hasNext() ? hash(seed, it.next()) ^ b2 ^ ++len : b2)) + seed,
5735                        mum((it.hasNext() ? hash(seed, it.next()) ^ b3 ^ ++len : b3), (it.hasNext() ? hash(seed, it.next()) ^ b4 ^ ++len : b4)));
5736            }
5737            return (int) mum(seed ^ seed << 16, len ^ b0);
5738        }
5739
5740        public static int hash(long seed, final List<? extends CharSequence> data) {
5741            if (data == null) return 0;
5742            seed += b1; seed ^= seed >>> 23 ^ seed >>> 48 ^ seed << 7 ^ seed << 53;
5743            final int len = data.size();
5744            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
5745                seed = mum(
5746                        mum(hash(seed, data.get(i-3)) ^ b1, hash(seed, data.get(i-2)) ^ b2) + seed,
5747                        mum(hash(seed, data.get(i-1)) ^ b3, hash(seed, data.get(i  )) ^ b4));
5748            }
5749            int t;
5750            switch (len & 3) {
5751                case 0: seed = mum(b1 ^ seed, b4 + seed); break;
5752                case 1: seed = mum(seed ^((t = hash(seed, data.get(len-1))) >>> 16), b3 ^ (t & 0xFFFFL)); break;
5753                case 2: seed = mum(seed ^ hash(seed, data.get(len-2)), b0 ^ hash(seed, data.get(len-1))); break;
5754                case 3: seed = mum(seed ^ hash(seed, data.get(len-3)), b2 ^ hash(seed, data.get(len-2))) ^ mum(seed ^ hash(seed, data.get(len-1)), b4); break;
5755            }
5756            return (int) mum(seed ^ seed << 16, len ^ b0);
5757        }

5778        public static int hash(long seed, final Object data) {
5779            if (data == null)
5780                return 0;
5781            seed += b1; seed ^= seed >>> 23 ^ seed >>> 48 ^ seed << 7 ^ seed << 53;
5782            return (int)((data.hashCode() + seed) * 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L >>> 32);

5787
5788    /**
5789     * Like Yolk, this is a class for hash functors, each an object with a 64-bit long seed. It uses an odd-but-fast
5790     * SIMD-friendly technique when hashing 32-bit items or smaller, and falls back to Yolk's algorithm when hashing
5791     * long values. If you are mainly hashing int arrays, short arrays, or byte arrays, this is probably the fastest
5792     * hash here unless the arrays are small (it outperforms all of the other hashes here on int arrays when those
5793     * arrays have length 50, and probably is faster than some sooner than that). Notably, on arrays 50 or longer this
5794     * runs in very close to half the time of {@link Arrays#hashCode(int[])}. This passes SMHasher for at least 64-bit
5795     * output. Has a lot of predefined functors (192, named after 24 Greek letters and 72 Goetic demons, see
5796     * <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lesser_Key_of_Solomon#The_Seventy-Two_Demons">Wikipedia for the demons</a>,
5797     * in both lower case and lower case with a trailing underscore). You probably want to use {@link #predefined}
5798     * instead of wrangling demon names; you can always choose an element from predefined with a 7-bit number, and there
5799     * are 64 numbers outside that range so you can choose any of those when a functor must be different.
5800     * <br>
5801     * This hash is much more effective with large inputs because it takes advantage of HotSpot's optimizations for code
5802     * that looks like a dot product over part of an array. The general concept for this hash came from the "Unrolled"
5803     * hash in <a href="https://richardstartin.github.io/posts/collecting-rocks-and-benchmarks">one of Richard Startin's
5804     * blog posts</a>, which traces back to
5805     * <a href="http://mail.openjdk.java.net/pipermail/core-libs-dev/2014-September/028898.html">Peter Levart posting a
5806     * related improvement on String.hashCode()</a> in 2014. This isn't as fast as Startin's "Vectorized" hash, but this
5807     * works on variable array lengths and also passes SMHasher.
5808     * <br>
5809     * The name curlup comes from an M.C. Escher painting of a creature, whose name translates to curl-up, that could
5810     * walk on six legs to climb stairs, or roll at high speeds when the conditions were right.
5811     */
5812    public static final class Curlup {
5813        private final long seed;
5814
5815        public Curlup(){
5816            this.seed = 0xC4CEB9FE1A85EC53L;
5817        }
5818        public Curlup(long seed)
5819        {
5820            this.seed = randomize(seed);
5821        }
5822
5823        /**
5824         * Very similar to Pelican and related unary hashes; uses "xor rotate xor rotate" as an early step to mix any
5825         * clustered bits all around the result, then the rest is like MurmurHash3's mixer.
5826         * @param seed any long; there is no fix point at 0
5827         * @return any long
5828         */
5829        public static long randomize(long seed) {
5830            seed ^= (seed << 41 | seed >>> 23) ^ (seed << 17 | seed >>> 47) ^ 0xCB9C59B3F9F87D4DL;
5831            seed *= 0x369DEA0F31A53F85L;
5832            seed ^= seed >>> 31;
5833            seed *= 0xDB4F0B9175AE2165L;
5834            return seed ^ seed >>> 28;
5835        }
5836
5837        public Curlup(final CharSequence seed)
5838        {
5839            this(Water.hash64(seed));
5840        }

5922        public long hash64(final boolean[] data) {
5923            if (data == null) return 0;
5924            long result = seed ^ data.length * 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
5925            int i = 0;

5927                result =  result      * 0xEBEDEED9D803C815L
5928                        + (data[i]     ? 0xD96EB1A810CAAF5FL : 0xCAAF5FD96EB1A810L)
5929                        + (data[i + 1] ? 0xC862B36DAF790DD5L : 0x790DD5C862B36DAFL)
5930                        + (data[i + 2] ? 0xB8ACD90C142FE10BL : 0x2FE10BB8ACD90C14L)
5931                        + (data[i + 3] ? 0xAA324F90DED86B69L : 0xD86B69AA324F90DEL)
5932                        + (data[i + 4] ? 0x9CDA5E693FEA10AFL : 0xEA10AF9CDA5E693FL)
5933                        + (data[i + 5] ? 0x908E3D2C82567A73L : 0x567A73908E3D2C82L)
5934                        + (data[i + 6] ? 0x8538ECB5BD456EA3L : 0x456EA38538ECB5BDL)
5935                        + (data[i + 7] ? 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L : 0x92ED03D1B54A32D1L)
5936                ;
5937            }
5938            for (; i < data.length; i++) {
5939                result = 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L * result + (data[i] ? 0xEBEDEED9D803C815L : 0xD9D803C815EBEDEEL);

5942            result ^= (result << 41 | result >>> 23) ^ (result << 17 | result >>> 47);
5943            result *= 0x369DEA0F31A53F85L;
5944            result ^= result >>> 31;
5945            result *= 0xDB4F0B9175AE2165L;

6112        public long hash64(final long[] data) {
6113            if (data == null) return 0;
6114            long seed = this.seed, a = this.seed + b4, b = this.seed + b3, c = this.seed + b2, d = this.seed + b1;
6115            final int len = data.length;
6116            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
6117                a ^= data[i-3] * b1; a = (a << 23 | a >>> 41) * b3;
6118                b ^= data[i-2] * b2; b = (b << 25 | b >>> 39) * b4;
6119                c ^= data[i-1] * b3; c = (c << 29 | c >>> 35) * b5;
6120                d ^= data[i  ] * b4; d = (d << 31 | d >>> 33) * b1;
6121                seed += a + b + c + d;
6122            }
6123            seed += b5;
6124            switch (len & 3) {
6125                case 1: seed = wow(seed, b1 ^ data[len-1]); break;
6126                case 2: seed = wow(seed + data[len-2], b2 + data[len-1]); break;
6127                case 3: seed = wow(seed + data[len-3], b2 + data[len-2]) ^ wow(seed + data[len-1], seed ^ b3); break;
6128            }
6129            seed = (seed ^ seed << 16) * (len ^ b0 ^ seed >>> 32);
6130            return seed - (seed >>> 31) + (seed << 33);
6131        }

6185        /**
6186         * Hashes only a subsection of the given data, starting at start (inclusive) and ending before end (exclusive).
6187         *
6188         * @param data  the char array to hash
6189         * @param start the start of the section to hash (inclusive)
6190         * @param end   the end of the section to hash (exclusive)
6191         * @return a 64-bit hash code for the requested section of data
6192         */
6193        public long hash64(final char[] data, final int start, final int end) {
6194            if (data == null || start >= end) return 0;
6195            final int len = Math.min(end, data.length);
6196
6197            long result = seed ^ (len - start) * 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
6198            int i = start;
6199            for (; i + 7 < len; i += 8) {
6200                result =  0xEBEDEED9D803C815L * result
6201                        + 0xD96EB1A810CAAF5FL * data[i]
6202                        + 0xC862B36DAF790DD5L * data[i + 1]
6203                        + 0xB8ACD90C142FE10BL * data[i + 2]
6204                        + 0xAA324F90DED86B69L * data[i + 3]
6205                        + 0x9CDA5E693FEA10AFL * data[i + 4]
6206                        + 0x908E3D2C82567A73L * data[i + 5]
6207                        + 0x8538ECB5BD456EA3L * data[i + 6]
6208                        + 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L * data[i + 7]
6209                ;
6210            }
6211            for (; i < len; i++) {
6212                result = 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L * result + data[i];
6213            }
6214            result *= 0x94D049BB133111EBL;
6215            result ^= (result << 41 | result >>> 23) ^ (result << 17 | result >>> 47);
6216            result *= 0x369DEA0F31A53F85L;
6217            result ^= result >>> 31;
6218            result *= 0xDB4F0B9175AE2165L;
6219            return (result ^ result >>> 28);
6220        }

6395        public long hash64(final Iterable<? extends CharSequence> data) {
6396            if (data == null) return 0;
6397            long seed = this.seed;
6398            final Iterator<? extends CharSequence> it = data.iterator();
6399            int len = 0;
6400            while (it.hasNext())
6401            {
6402                ++len;
6403                seed = mum(
6404                        mum(hash(it.next()) ^ b1, (it.hasNext() ? hash(it.next()) ^ b2 ^ ++len : b2)) + seed,
6405                        mum((it.hasNext() ? hash(it.next()) ^ b3 ^ ++len : b3), (it.hasNext() ? hash(it.next()) ^ b4 ^ ++len : b4)));
6406            }
6407            seed = (seed ^ seed << 16) * (len ^ b0);
6408            return seed - (seed >>> 31) + (seed << 33);
6409        }

6664        public int hash(final long[] data) {
6665            if (data == null) return 0;
6666            long seed = this.seed, a = this.seed + b4, b = this.seed + b3, c = this.seed + b2, d = this.seed + b1;
6667            final int len = data.length;
6668            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
6669                a ^= data[i-3] * b1; a = (a << 23 | a >>> 41) * b3;
6670                b ^= data[i-2] * b2; b = (b << 25 | b >>> 39) * b4;
6671                c ^= data[i-1] * b3; c = (c << 29 | c >>> 35) * b5;
6672                d ^= data[i  ] * b4; d = (d << 31 | d >>> 33) * b1;
6673                seed += a + b + c + d;
6674            }
6675            seed += b5;
6676            switch (len & 3) {
6677                case 1: seed = wow(seed, b1 ^ data[len-1]); break;
6678                case 2: seed = wow(seed + data[len-2], b2 + data[len-1]); break;
6679                case 3: seed = wow(seed + data[len-3], b2 + data[len-2]) ^ wow(seed + data[len-1], seed ^ b3); break;
6680            }
6681            seed = (seed ^ seed << 16) * (len ^ b0 ^ seed >>> 32);
6682            return (int)(seed - (seed >>> 32));
6683        }

6745         */

6747            if (data == null || start >= end) return 0;
6748            final int len = Math.min(end, data.length);
6749
6750            long result = seed ^ (len - start) * 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
6751            int i = start;
6752            for (; i + 7 < len; i += 8) {

6754                        + 0xD96EB1A810CAAF5FL * data[i]
6755                        + 0xC862B36DAF790DD5L * data[i + 1]
6756                        + 0xB8ACD90C142FE10BL * data[i + 2]
6757                        + 0xAA324F90DED86B69L * data[i + 3]

6760                        + 0x8538ECB5BD456EA3L * data[i + 6]
6761                        + 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L * data[i + 7]
6762                ;
6763            }

6766            }

6768            result ^= (result << 41 | result >>> 23) ^ (result << 17 | result >>> 47);
6769            result *= 0x369DEA0F31A53F85L;
6770            result ^= result >>> 31;

6948        public int hash(final Iterable<? extends CharSequence> data) {
6949            if (data == null) return 0;
6950            long seed = this.seed;
6951            final Iterator<? extends CharSequence> it = data.iterator();
6952            int len = 0;
6953            while (it.hasNext())
6954            {
6955                ++len;
6956                seed = mum(
6957                        mum(hash(it.next()) ^ b1, (it.hasNext() ? hash(it.next()) ^ b2 ^ ++len : b2)) + seed,
6958                        mum((it.hasNext() ? hash(it.next()) ^ b3 ^ ++len : b3), (it.hasNext() ? hash(it.next()) ^ b4 ^ ++len : b4)));
6959            }
6960            return (int) mum(seed ^ seed << 16, len ^ b0);
6961        }

7056        public static long hash64(final long seed, final boolean[] data) {
7057            if (data == null) return 0;
7058            long result = randomize(seed) ^ data.length * 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
7059            int i = 0;
7060            for (; i + 7 < data.length; i += 8) {
7061                result =  result      * 0xEBEDEED9D803C815L
7062                        + (data[i]     ? 0xD96EB1A810CAAF5FL : 0xCAAF5FD96EB1A810L)
7063                        + (data[i + 1] ? 0xC862B36DAF790DD5L : 0x790DD5C862B36DAFL)
7064                        + (data[i + 2] ? 0xB8ACD90C142FE10BL : 0x2FE10BB8ACD90C14L)
7065                        + (data[i + 3] ? 0xAA324F90DED86B69L : 0xD86B69AA324F90DEL)
7066                        + (data[i + 4] ? 0x9CDA5E693FEA10AFL : 0xEA10AF9CDA5E693FL)
7067                        + (data[i + 5] ? 0x908E3D2C82567A73L : 0x567A73908E3D2C82L)
7068                        + (data[i + 6] ? 0x8538ECB5BD456EA3L : 0x456EA38538ECB5BDL)
7069                        + (data[i + 7] ? 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L : 0x92ED03D1B54A32D1L)
7070                ;
7071            }
7072            for (; i < data.length; i++) {
7073                result = 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L * result + (data[i] ? 0xEBEDEED9D803C815L : 0xD9D803C815EBEDEEL);
7074            }
7075            result *= 0x94D049BB133111EBL;
7076            result ^= (result << 41 | result >>> 23) ^ (result << 17 | result >>> 47);
7077            result *= 0x369DEA0F31A53F85L;
7078            result ^= result >>> 31;
7079            result *= 0xDB4F0B9175AE2165L;
7080            return (result ^ result >>> 28);
7081        }

7246        public static long hash64(final long seed, final long[] data) {
7247            if (data == null) return 0;
7248            long s = randomize(seed), a = s + b4, b = s + b3, c = s + b2, d = s + b1;
7249            final int len = data.length;
7250            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
7251                a ^= data[i-3] * b1; a = (a << 23 | a >>> 41) * b3;
7252                b ^= data[i-2] * b2; b = (b << 25 | b >>> 39) * b4;
7253                c ^= data[i-1] * b3; c = (c << 29 | c >>> 35) * b5;
7254                d ^= data[i  ] * b4; d = (d << 31 | d >>> 33) * b1;
7255                s += a + b + c + d;
7256            }
7257            s += b5;
7258            switch (len & 3) {
7259                case 1: s = wow(s, b1 ^ data[len-1]); break;
7260                case 2: s = wow(s + data[len-2], b2 + data[len-1]); break;
7261                case 3: s = wow(s + data[len-3], b2 + data[len-2]) ^ wow(s + data[len-1], s ^ b3); break;
7262            }
7263            s = (s ^ s << 16) * (len ^ b0 ^ s >>> 32);
7264            return s - (s >>> 31) + (s << 33);
7265        }

7333            for (; i + 7 < len; i += 8) {

7335                        + 0xD96EB1A810CAAF5FL * data[i]
7336                        + 0xC862B36DAF790DD5L * data[i + 1]

7342                        + 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L * data[i + 7]
7343                ;
7344            }
7345            for (; i < len; i++) {
7346                result = 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L * result + data[i];
7347            }
7348            result *= 0x94D049BB133111EBL;

7350            result *= 0x369DEA0F31A53F85L;

7529        public static long hash64(final long seed, final Iterable<? extends CharSequence> data) {
7530            if (data == null) return 0;
7531            long s = randomize(seed);
7532            final Iterator<? extends CharSequence> it = data.iterator();
7533            int len = 0;
7534            while (it.hasNext())
7535            {
7536                ++len;
7537                s = mum(
7538                        mum(hash(seed, it.next()) ^ b1, (it.hasNext() ? hash(seed, it.next()) ^ b2 ^ ++len : b2)) + s,
7539                        mum((it.hasNext() ? hash(seed, it.next()) ^ b3 ^ ++len : b3), (it.hasNext() ? hash(seed, it.next()) ^ b4 ^ ++len : b4)));
7540            }
7541            s = (s ^ s << 16) * (len ^ b0);
7542            return s - (s >>> 31) + (s << 33);
7543        }

7608        public static int hash(final long seed, final boolean[] data) {
7609            if (data == null) return 0;
7610            long result = randomize(seed) ^ data.length * 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
7611            int i = 0;
7612            for (; i + 7 < data.length; i += 8) {
7613                result =  result      * 0xEBEDEED9D803C815L
7614                        + (data[i]     ? 0xD96EB1A810CAAF5FL : 0xCAAF5FD96EB1A810L)
7615                        + (data[i + 1] ? 0xC862B36DAF790DD5L : 0x790DD5C862B36DAFL)
7616                        + (data[i + 2] ? 0xB8ACD90C142FE10BL : 0x2FE10BB8ACD90C14L)
7617                        + (data[i + 3] ? 0xAA324F90DED86B69L : 0xD86B69AA324F90DEL)
7618                        + (data[i + 4] ? 0x9CDA5E693FEA10AFL : 0xEA10AF9CDA5E693FL)
7619                        + (data[i + 5] ? 0x908E3D2C82567A73L : 0x567A73908E3D2C82L)
7620                        + (data[i + 6] ? 0x8538ECB5BD456EA3L : 0x456EA38538ECB5BDL)
7621                        + (data[i + 7] ? 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L : 0x92ED03D1B54A32D1L)
7622                ;
7623            }
7624            for (; i < data.length; i++) {
7625                result = 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L * result + (data[i] ? 0xEBEDEED9D803C815L : 0xD9D803C815EBEDEEL);
7626            }
7627            result *= 0x94D049BB133111EBL;
7628            result ^= (result << 41 | result >>> 23) ^ (result << 17 | result >>> 47);
7629            result *= 0x369DEA0F31A53F85L;
7630            result ^= result >>> 31;
7631            result *= 0xDB4F0B9175AE2165L;
7632            return (int)(result ^ result >>> 28);
7633        }

7798        public static int hash(final long seed, final long[] data) {
7799            if (data == null) return 0;
7800            long s = randomize(seed), a = s + b4, b = s + b3, c = s + b2, d = s + b1;
7801            final int len = data.length;
7802            for (int i = 3; i < len; i+=4) {
7803                a ^= data[i-3] * b1; a = (a << 23 | a >>> 41) * b3;
7804                b ^= data[i-2] * b2; b = (b << 25 | b >>> 39) * b4;
7805                c ^= data[i-1] * b3; c = (c << 29 | c >>> 35) * b5;
7806                d ^= data[i  ] * b4; d = (d << 31 | d >>> 33) * b1;
7807                s += a + b + c + d;
7808            }
7809            s += b5;
7810            switch (len & 3) {
7811                case 1: s = wow(s, b1 ^ data[len-1]); break;
7812                case 2: s = wow(s + data[len-2], b2 + data[len-1]); break;
7813                case 3: s = wow(s + data[len-3], b2 + data[len-2]) ^ wow(s + data[len-1], s ^ b3); break;
7814            }
7815            s = (s ^ s << 16) * (len ^ b0 ^ s >>> 32);
7816            return (int)(s - (s >>> 32));
7817        }

7872        /**
7873         * Hashes only a subsection of the given data, starting at start (inclusive) and ending before end (exclusive).
7874         *
7875         * @param data  the char array to hash
7876         * @param start the start of the section to hash (inclusive)
7877         * @param end   the end of the section to hash (exclusive)
7878         * @return a 64-bit hash code for the requested section of data
7879         */
7880        public static int hash(final long seed, final char[] data, final int start, final int end) {
7881            if (data == null || start >= end) return 0;
7882            final int len = Math.min(end, data.length);
7883
7884            long result = randomize(seed) ^ (len - start) * 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L;
7885            int i = start;
7886            for (; i + 7 < len; i += 8) {
7887                result =  0xEBEDEED9D803C815L * result
7888                        + 0xD96EB1A810CAAF5FL * data[i]
7889                        + 0xC862B36DAF790DD5L * data[i + 1]
7890                        + 0xB8ACD90C142FE10BL * data[i + 2]
7891                        + 0xAA324F90DED86B69L * data[i + 3]
7892                        + 0x9CDA5E693FEA10AFL * data[i + 4]
7893                        + 0x908E3D2C82567A73L * data[i + 5]
7894                        + 0x8538ECB5BD456EA3L * data[i + 6]
7895                        + 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L * data[i + 7]
7896                ;
7897            }
7898            for (; i < len; i++) {
7899                result = 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L * result + data[i];
7900            }
7901            result *= 0x94D049BB133111EBL;
7902            result ^= (result << 41 | result >>> 23) ^ (result << 17 | result >>> 47);
7903            result *= 0x369DEA0F31A53F85L;
7904            result ^= result >>> 31;
7905            result *= 0xDB4F0B9175AE2165L;
7906            return (int)(result ^ result >>> 28);
7907        }

8082        public static int hash(final long seed, final Iterable<? extends CharSequence> data) {
8083            if (data == null) return 0;
8084            long s = randomize(seed);
8085            final Iterator<? extends CharSequence> it = data.iterator();
8086            int len = 0;
8087            while (it.hasNext())
8088            {
8089                ++len;
8090                s = mum(
8091                        mum(hash(seed, it.next()) ^ b1, (it.hasNext() ? hash(seed, it.next()) ^ b2 ^ ++len : b2)) + s,
8092                        mum((it.hasNext() ? hash(seed, it.next()) ^ b3 ^ ++len : b3), (it.hasNext() ? hash(seed, it.next()) ^ b4 ^ ++len : b4)));
8093            }
8094            return (int) mum(s ^ s << 16, len ^ b0);
8095        }

8153        public static int hash(final long seed, final Object data) {
